intro: Sium bulbocastanum, commonly known as the water parsnip, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is an important species for wetland ecosystems.
